**Flopmind's Author Page**
**Author:** [[*user Flopmind]]
**Published on 17 Aug 2024**

Thanks to [[*user Lt Flops]] and other contributors to [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/theme:pataphysics The 'Pataphysics Department Theme].

[[/<]]
[[include :scp-wiki:info:end]]
[[/>]]

[[div class="textBlock"]]
[[=]]
+* What Is This?
[[/=]]
----
Welcome to my Author Page! Thanks for visiting!

This is [[*user Flopmind]], not to be confused with [[*user Lt Flops]] and her author page.

This is just here because I've qualified for one for forever now, and I've decided its past time I buckle down and make one, even a modest one.

Here I shall track my articles, tales, and other such posts. I'll also include thank you's, achievements, and the like.

I hope this page grants you a modicum of joy, inspiration, and/or productivity.
[[/div]]

[[tabview]]
[[tab Articles]]
+ [[[SCP-5738]]]
This is my first successful article and the one I remain the most proud of to this day. It's about the horrifying realities of stopping time. Check it out if you enjoy realistic-ish physics (built atop an anomalous effect, of course) and time shenanigans.

I cannot thank the community enough for their patience and assistance getting to the point that I was prepared to publish this article.

+ [[[SCP-5183]]]
5183 is built to be an article on the small scale of the world, focusing on more personal tragedies. It's meant to establish the moral ambiguity and deception of the Foundation in a lower scale.

I won't pretend this one turned out like a grand success, but I'm glad I made an article that was more mundane and less earth-shattering in nature.

+ [[[SCP-6018]]]
6018 is almost certainly the strongest article in terms of sheer premise, but, sadly, it is lacking in execution. I've queried people better and more accomplished than myself about rewriting it once or twice, but it's never amounted to anything. If you're interested, please let me know. Perhaps I'll get around to it one of these days.

+ [[[SCP-7322]]]
7322 is a short form article, often described as fridge horror. It seems very hit-or-miss for people, but I'm happy with how it turned out.
[[/tab]]
[[tab Tales]]
+ [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/qualitytime Quality Time]
My first tale and initial entry for the [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/romcon 2023 RomCon]! Watch Flemming bumble his way through a terrifyingly wrong meet-cute!

+ [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/draggedout Dragged Out]
My second tale and second entry for the very same contest. It turned out a bit more rushed than I'd have liked, but that's that way the cookie crumbles sometimes.
[[/tab]]
